title: ASL 2.5 ‚Äî Places & Activities üè†üè´üè¨
objectives: Combine common places (HOME, SCHOOL, STORE, LIBRARY, PARK) with activity verbs (GO, STUDY, PLAY, READ, WRITE)
Use YES/NO and WH question forms (WHERE, DO-DO?) with correct NMMs
Apply time-first structure to talk about where you go and what you do

vocab.def: Core activity verbs used with places.
WH-question asking what activity someone does.
Brows up for yes/no questions (e.g., YOU GO SCHOOL?).
Placing time at sentence start for clarity.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Place Row

media.caption: Drill the place set, small/compact motion

sections.body: Model once; then mirror with **neutral wrist** and **compact space**. Reset to neutral between signs.

microCheck.q: Which helps clarity most when listing places?

callouts.title: Ergonomics
callouts.body: Tiny breaks every 5‚Äì7 minutes; relax shoulders.

callouts.title: Eye Gaze
callouts.body: Receivers: look at the **face**; signers: keep motions centered.

sections.heading: Model: Time ‚Üí Place ‚Üí Do-What

media.caption: TODAY AFTERNOON I STUDY SCHOOL. TONIGHT I READ HOME.

sections.body: Use **TIME ‚Üí PRONOUN ‚Üí VERB ‚Üí PLACE**. Examples: **TODAY AFTERNOON I STUDY SCHOOL.** **TONIGHT I READ HOME.** Keep a tiny pause after the time chunk.

sections.heading: Questions: YES/NO vs WHERE / DO-DO?
sections.body:
**YES/NO (brows up):** **YOU GO SCHOOL TODAY?**  
**WH (brows down):** **TODAY YOU WHERE GO?** / **TODAY YOU DO-DO?**  
Answers short and clear: **I GO SCHOOL.** **I READ LIBRARY.**

callouts.title: Frames
callouts.body: WHERE-frame: **TODAY AFTERNOON YOU GO WHERE?** ‚Üí **PARK.**  DO-DO-frame: **TONIGHT YOU DO-DO?** ‚Üí **READ HOME.**

microCheck.q: Correct NMM for WHERE and DO-DO?

sections.teacherNote: Spotlight brow shape; cue learners to mirror WH-face.

sections.heading: Partner Loop: Where + Activity
sections.body: A asks **TOMORROW YOU GO WHERE?** ‚Üí B answers **PARK** (or **I GO PARK**). Then A asks **TODAY AFTERNOON YOU DO-DO?** ‚Üí B answers **STUDY SCHOOL.** Switch roles.

callouts.title: Feedback Stem
callouts.body: ‚ÄúTry **time-first** then small pause; your WHERE face can be stronger.‚Äù

microCheck.q: Best follow-up to a vague answer like ‚ÄúGO‚Äù?

sections.teacherNote: Differentiate with icon cards; allow seated practice; keep moves compact.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **10‚Äì15s**: 2 statements + 1 question. Example: **TODAY I STUDY SCHOOL. TONIGHT I READ HOME. TOMORROW YOU GO WHERE?**
sections.teacherNote: Offer privacy submission. Ask for captions noting **time-first** + **NMM control**.

items.q: Best response to DO-DO? (TONIGHT YOU DO-DO?)
Write an ASL gloss: TOMORROW MORNING WE PLAY PARK. Include time-first.

items.prompt: Which felt harder‚ÄîWHERE or DO-DO? What cue will you practice to improve NMMs?

reflectionPrompt: Submit your mini-clip (2 statements + 1 question) using time-first + correct NMMs.
summary: You can talk about where you go and what you do using time-first, clear place + activity frames, and accurate YES/NO vs WH NMMs.
